channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish on the pavement, 10th October
item.description:
This rubbish has been on the pavement for months. I can see that it has been reported several times yet nothing has been done. Foxes are dragging waste all around the neighbourhood and can be found in everyone's front gardens. Can you please clean up

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Keedonwood Road Please clear Flytip of Garden Waste from Corner Grass Area, 10th October
item.description:
You have received a request via Love Clean Streets to remedy an issue within your Service Area Fly-tipping Lat/Long - 51.4222492757148, 0.0121060765972247 what3words - weedy.fresh.plenty Nearest address - 15 Bonville Road, Bromley, BR1 4QA

item.title: Constant flytipping, 10th October
item.description:
We’re in desperate need of some enforcement round here. It’s like living in a slum. Most parts of the pavements are impassable due to rubbish and overgrown vegetation. It shouldn’t be hard to identify the source as the address is plastered all over the boxes. I don’t appreciate having to walk with my toddlers in the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bernal Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left outside house, 10th October
item.description:
HMO residents at 312 Sutherland Avenue continuously leave rubbish outside rented property. Multiple delivery drivers live there and rubbish stays for weeks. Recently divan bed left on pavement for 2-3 weeks now in front garden. Currently have rubbish outside property including lawn mower box and orange delivery bag.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sutherland Avenue, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public tree requires pruning - health and safety concerns to pedestrians / road users, 10th October
item.description:
The large plane tree on pavement Kent House Lane (between Cricket Lane and Gardener Industrial Estate approx 50 feet from Cricket Lane - same side of road ), has grown so big it is causing various health and safety risks ie: The street light, lighting has been obscured by branches, so much that this is causing a potential danger and safety implications to pedestrians walking on the pavement at night because the area is so dark in the Winter. By obscuring the street light it also presents dangers and risks to nearby residents. This tree has also extended over the roofs of at least 3 of the nearby terraced houses, causing damage to roof tiles which has required replacement, caused by debris / branches from tree falling. In addition to the above the tree has encroached into the road so much so that it hits the roofs of high sided vehicles which causes a catapult affect which potentially presents danger to pedestrians / other drivers should the branch breaks off. Potential damage to roof of vehicles when residents pulling off driveways. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Lane, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement uneven and not wide enough between Nollywood and Bullace row, 10th October
item.description:
Pavement is very uneven and a trip hazard as a result of the pavement being dug up several times. Difficult to walk on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Camberwell Green, Camberwell, London

item.title: Crumbling tarmac pavement, 10th October
item.description:
The tarmac pavement is crumbling and causing a trip hazard. It has been getting steadily worse for some time. Logs Hill is very narrow and there is no available pavement on the other side of the road so it is important that this one is maintained. Large numbers of schoolchildren use the pavement every day so safety is particularly important in this case.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Logs Hill, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins on pavement since Christmas, 10th October
item.description:
No 72 flats 1,2 and 3 will not touch the bins after collection. They are only put away when a passer by does it. People are treating them as public bins 24hrs a day. Blind people and invalid carriages have to cross the road to the eneven pavement to go around. Someone from the council was dealing with it but haven’t been back since Christmas.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole pavement is uneven, broken slabs, rocking paving slabs., 10th October
item.description:
The right hand side of Hollies Avenue going from Old Farm Avenue to Halfway Street has uneven, broken paving slabs including ones that rock. It is the whole side and not just a couple. I tripped and fell on this uneven one whilst wearing trainers. I’ve sprained my ankle, cut and damaged my knee and hit my forehead. I’m lucky I haven’t broken anything but the road is so bad that is bound to happen soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollies Avenue, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
